poem.title: A rag in C
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: The flesh is bruckle the fiend is slee Stamp to your ankle, straight-back down The clucking dice, the clatteran scree. Get to the bergschrund, check your bindings, Lean into the void and ski The magic mountain, Sri Menakshi's Plaster-plated ghopuram Of toothpaste-pink, mustachioed Cadets who, to the camera, say "spree". Sea spray. A rag in the unlikely mode of C. Show me a canvas and I might just see.
